Time online has generated a short list (very short) of the worst sites infiltrating our beloved Interweb. I would have to greatly agree with the evaluation of these journalists as most of these sites just plain annoy me. The list is as follows:

eHarmony.com – After completing your 426 question survey and paying your monthly premium, you can still possibly be rejected as “unmatchable”.

Evite.com – Have you ever gotten one of these? Not worth the time/effort. Good idea gone terribly wrong, use facebook.

Meez.com – Never heard of it. Apparently a service to trash up your e-mail (and take up too much space in inboxes) .

MySpace.com – Agreed. Justice.

SecondLife.com – Live a second life online, if you can spend a few hours figuring it out, and then enough time to lead another life (slow loading times included).

Now, they have also composed another list of “25 Sites We Can’t Live Without” which contains several of my regular visits including ESPN.com, Amazon.com, Ebay.com, Google.com, and HowStuffWorks.com, among others. Check out the lists, which sites do you think are the worst? Which can’t you live without?
